distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for libarchive is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libarchive programming library can create and read several different streaming archive formats, including GNU tar, cpio and ISO 9660 CD-ROM images. Libarchive is used notably in the bsdtar utility, scripting language bindings such as python-libarchive, and several popular desktop file managers.

Security Fix(es):

* A flaw was found in the way libarchive handled hardlink archive entries of non-zero size. Combined with flaws in libarchive's file system sandboxing, this issue could cause an application using libarchive to overwrite arbitrary files with arbitrary data from the archive. (CVE-2016-5418)

* Multiple out-of-bounds read flaws were found in libarchive. Specially crafted AR or MTREE files could cause the application to read data out of bounds, potentially disclosing a small amount of application memory, or causing an application crash. (CVE-2015-8920, CVE-2015-8921)

* A denial of service vulnerability was found in libarchive's handling of GZIP streams. A crafted GZIP file could cause libarchive to allocate an excessive amount of memory, eventually leading to a crash. (CVE-2016-7166)

* A denial of service vulnerability was found in libarchive. A specially crafted CPIO archive containing a symbolic link to a large target path could cause memory allocation to fail, causing an application using libarchive that attempted to view or extract such archive to crash. (CVE-2016-4809)

* Multiple instances of undefined behavior due to arithmetic overflow were found in libarchive. Specially crafted Compress streams or ISO9660 volumes could potentially cause the application to fail to read the archive, or to crash. (CVE-2015-8932, CVE-2016-5844)

Red Hat would like to thank Insomnia Security for reporting CVE-2016-5418.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in libarchive.  A specially crafted AR archive could cause the application to read a single byte of application memory, potentially disclosing it to the attacker.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Stack out of bounds read in ar parser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: Stack out of bounds read in ar parser

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in libarchive.  A specially crafted mtree file could cause libarchive to read beyond a statically declared structure, potentially disclosing application memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Global out of bounds read in mtree parser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: Global out of bounds read in mtree parser

notes.text: Undefined behavior (invalid left shift) was discovered in libarchive, in how Compress streams are identified.  This could cause certain files to be mistakenly identified as Compress archives and fail to read.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Undefined behavior / invalid shiftleft in TAR parser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: Undefined behavior / invalid shiftleft in TAR parser

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in libarchive. A specially crafted cpio archive containing a symbolic link to a ridiculously large target path can cause memory allocation to fail, resulting in any attempt to view or extract the archive crashing.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Memory allocate error with symbolic links in cpio archives
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: Memory allocate error with symbolic links in cpio archives

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way libarchive handled hardlink archive entries of non-zero size. Combined with flaws in libarchive's file system sandboxing, this issue could cause an application using libarchive to overwrite arbitrary files with arbitrary data from the archive.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Archive Entry with type 1 (hardlink), but has a non-zero data size file overwrite
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: Archive Entry with type 1 (hardlink), but has a non-zero data size file overwrite

notes.text: Undefined behavior (signed integer overflow) was discovered in libarchive, in the ISO parser.  A crafted file could potentially cause denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: undefined behaviour (integer overflow) in iso parser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libarchive: undefined behaviour (integer overflow) in iso parser

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in libarchive. A specially crafted gzip file can cause libarchive to allocate memory without limit, eventually leading to a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libarchive: Denial of service using a crafted gzip file
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
